name: $baseFormulaType
desc: Returns: The type of enteral or infant formula such as an adult standard formula with fiber or a soy-based infant formula.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The type of enteral or infant formula such as an adult standard formula with fiber or a soy-based infant formula.

name: $baseFormulaProductName
desc: Returns: The product or brand name of the enteral or infant formula product such as "ACME Adult Standard Formula".

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The product or brand name of the enteral or infant formula product such as "ACME Adult Standard Formula".

name: $additiveType
desc: Returns: Indicates the type of modular component such as protein, carbohydrate, fat or fiber to be provided in addition to or mixed with the base formula.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Indicates the type of modular component such as protein, carbohydrate, fat or fiber to be provided in addition to or mixed with the base formula.

name: $additiveProductName
desc: Returns: The product or brand name of the type of modular component to be added to the formula.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The product or brand name of the type of modular component to be added to the formula.

name: $caloricDensity
desc: Returns: The amount of energy (calories) that the formula should provide per specified volume, typically per mL or fluid oz.  For example, an infant may require a formula that provides 24 calories per fluid ounce or an adult may require an enteral formula that provides 1.5 calorie/mL.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The amount of energy (calories) that the formula should provide per specified volume, typically per mL or fluid oz.  For example, an infant may require a formula that provides 24 calories per fluid ounce or an adult may require an enteral formula that pro

name: $routeofAdministration
desc: Returns: The route or physiological path of administration into the patient's gastrointestinal  tract for purposes of providing the formula feeding, e.g. nasogastric tube.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The route or physiological path of administration into the patient's gastrointestinal  tract for purposes of providing the formula feeding, e.g. nasogastric tube.

name: $administration
desc: Returns: Formula administration instructions as structured data.  This repeating structure allows for changing the administration rate or volume over time for both bolus and continuous feeding.  An example of this would be an instruction to increase the rate of continuous feeding every 2 hours.

name: $addadministration
desc: Formula administration instructions as structured data.  This repeating structure allows for changing the administration rate or volume over time for both bolus and continuous feeding.  An example of this would be an instruction to increase the rate of continuous feeding every 2 hours.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: Formula administration instructions as structured data.  This repeating structure allows for changing the administration rate or volume over time for both bolus and continuous feeding.  An example of this would be an instruction to increase the rate of co

name: $maxVolumeToDeliver
desc: Returns: The maximum total quantity of formula that may be administered to a subject over the period of time, e.g. 1440 mL over 24 hours.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The maximum total quantity of formula that may be administered to a subject over the period of time, e.g. 1440 mL over 24 hours.

name: $administrationInstruction
desc: Returns: Free text formula administration, feeding instructions or additional instructions or information.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Free text formula administration, feeding instructions or additional instructions or information.
